Posts.Content: Hello Ladies. My mastectomy surgery went well yesterday. I went into the operating room feeling at peace thanks to all of you! Thank you all for your prayers, words and thoughts of encouragement, and for all the positive energy! I felt surrounded by so much love and support. Thank you so much. I'm home now and going to have a nap. Love, Maria xoxox
Posts.Title: Two Kindred Spirits need the Magic Pink Bus and our Prayers for appointments on Wednesday and Thursday

Posts.Content: Donna, Thank You So Much for putting the call out for me and for mwallace 1325. Just a short post tonight. I have to get up tomorrow morning at 5am (PST) and must be at the hospital at 6am. My mastectomy surgery should begin around 7:30am and will take approximately 1.5 to 2 hours long. I will be kept in hospital for one night and discharged sometime Thursday. My girls are with their Uma and Grandpa tonight and will stay with them for until possibly Friday. I appreciate all of your prayers, positive thoughts and energies. I will post an update when I get home from the hospital.
Posts.Title: Two Kindred Spirits need the Magic Pink Bus and our Prayers for appointments on Wednesday and Thursday

Posts.Content: Hi there. That is exactly how I found the lump in my breast last year. It hurt to touch or bump it and it was mobile. After my surgeon removed it, she explained it probably hurt because the tumor was growing in and around nerves. Are you having it biopsied or removed?
Posts.Title: feels different than last time

Posts.Content: Are you still in treatment? My eyebrows and hair grew back fairly quickly post chemo. You should check with your docs though just to make sure it's o.k.
Posts.Title: Permanent makeup - a vanity issue

Posts.Content: I don't really know how or why, but I'm feeling overwhelmingly anxious, and emotionally sensitive as I come closer to my last radiation appointment on the 15th. I've come through so much and I'm beginning to feel lost and confused. I'm weepy a lot these days, mind you, there are many other things going on in our lives that are stressful and emotionally draining. Some days I feel like I'm going crazy. I'm not sleeping well, I'm having nightmares, anxiety attacks, and migraine headaches. Can anyone else relate to feeling this way? What can I do?
Posts.Title: Having a really hard time...

Posts.Content: Hello Ladies. I thought those of you with TNBC would like to read this article on the most recent findings and hopefully promising treatments ahead... http://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2011/06/110627184000.htm
Posts.Title: Different Subtypes of Triple-Negative Breast Cancer Respond to Different Therapies

Posts.Content: "It makes no sense to worry about things you have no control over because there's nothing you can do about them, and why worry about things you do control? The activity of worrying keeps you immobilized." Dr. Wayne Dyer
Posts.Title: OT Don't Worry
